item.title: Can't get object ID's?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:7, topic:471198”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=588736.msg4174075#msg4174075 date=1354752331]

     case 132: // Object Click *1st*
          int objectID = inStream.readUnsignedWord();
          int objectX = inStream.readSignedWordBigEndianA();
          int objectY = inStream.readUnsignedWordA();
	  pushText("Object First-Click ID: " + objectID + " X Position: " + objectX + " Y Position: " + objectY + ".");
     break;

You construct them like the others.

Thanks, it worked
Mine was in Action handler, under the firstClickObject void, I moved to the clickObject class.
I’ll have to go get the other debug code working, I’m sure I can figure it out.
Edit:
Apparently, my two staircases that I’m trying to edit (Lumby, 2nd floor) have the same ID. But if you click on one of them, the dialogue to go up or down pops up, but not for the other.
Ideas on how to fix?
[/quote]

They both have the same I.D? Add a condition that checks Player-Character Coordinates with the I.D. for the duplicate Object.[/quote]
I did close to that lol
I assigned a check to make it see the object X and Y.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't get object ID's?
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:5, topic:471198”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=588736.msg4174062#msg4174062 date=1354751450]

     case 132: // Object Click *1st*
          int objectID = inStream.readUnsignedWord();
          int objectX = inStream.readSignedWordBigEndianA();
          int objectY = inStream.readUnsignedWordA();
	  pushText("Object First-Click ID: " + objectID + " X Position: " + objectX + " Y Position: " + objectY + ".");
     break;

You construct them like the others.
[/quote]
Thanks, it worked
Mine was in Action handler, under the firstClickObject void, I moved to the clickObject class.
I’ll have to go get the other debug code working, I’m sure I can figure it out.
Edit:
Apparently, my two staircases that I’m trying to edit (Lumby, 2nd floor) have the same ID. But if you click on one of them, the dialogue to go up or down pops up, but not for the other.
Ideas on how to fix?[/quote]

They both have the same I.D? Add a condition that checks Player-Character Coordinates with the I.D. for the duplicate Object.

item.title: Can't get object ID's?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I guess you can say I need some debug code. I need the codes for if you use objects on items, items on items, item on player, etc. The only actual debug code I have is for first click object.

The funny thing is, I need some help getting an ID for a stair case. When I click it, nothing shows up in the server cmd, but if I click any other staircase, or other object, it does.
Here’s my first click object code:

if(c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("MyUserNAme")){ Misc.println("objectId: "+c.objectId+" ObjectX: "+c.objectX+ " objectY: "+c.objectY+" Xoff: "+ (c.getX() - c.objectX)+" Yoff: "+ (c.getY() - c.objectY)); }

Read full topic
